info.title: Open Food Trust Documents API
info.description: The Documents API enables creation/upload, view and share capabilities of relevant supply chain documents of any type. ## Document linking and focus A document can be linked to traceable elements such as facilities, products, and EPCs. Linkage is supported by utilizing the JSON-LD data linking format. ## Document sharing A document is created with `private` permissions by default. Private documents can be viewed only by registered users in the organization that owns the document. Methods for sharing documents with other organizations are described below. ### Linked documents A linked document can be implicitly shared with other organizations by setting the document's `permissionsMode` to `linked`. Organizations with access to the document focus will be able to view the linked document, in their document library and trace results. ### Explicitly shared documents Both `private` and `linked` documents can be explicitly shared with organizations specified by `permittedOrgIds` in the permissions information.

post.description:
Creates a new document with the specified properties, content (via file upload) and permissions information.

## Request body

The request body must include valid MIME `multipart/form-data`. While the properties piece is required, the `content` and `permissions` pieces are optional. By default permissions is set to `private` so that only the document owners can access it.

### Properties 

The required `properties` piece of the request body must be valid JSON with a defined `documentType` and the required properties for that document type. Call `GET /categories` to retrieve the defined document categories and types and `GET /templates/{documentType}` to retrieve a document template. Once created, the `documentType` cannot be changed.

The `issueDate` and `expiryDate` properties should be used to specify issue and expirations dates for the document. #### Custom properties

Custom properties that aren't present in the schema can be set using the `customProperties` property by passing in an array. Each custom property in the array will need specify a `name` for the property and `value`. 

#### Properties example

The following example shows JSON syntax for both predefined and custom properties:

```json
{
  "documentType": "Generic Document",
  "documentTitle": "CTR Report 1924",
  "issueDate": "2019-12-01",
  "customProperties": [
    {
      "name": "Site Location",
      "value": "9501101530003",
      "format": "gln"
    },
    {
      "name": "Site Age",
      "value": 5
    },
    {
      "name": "Related product",
      "value": "95011015300038",
      "format": "gtin"
    }
  ]
}
```

## Content

The `content` piece of the request body specifies the document file to be uploaded.
Specifying the `content` is optional.

##Permissions

The `permissions` part (JSON) of the request body specifies the document permissions. The default document permissions is set to `private`limiting access to only the document owners. In order to give access to other organizations use the `permittedOrgIds` property

## Responses

Document upload is asynchronous. A `POST /documents` request will either return an HTTP 201 (Created) or HTTP 202 (Accepted) response depending on if the document was created or is still processing. An HTTP 201 response indicates the document was successfully created and returns the newly created document ID (`id`).

An HTTP 202 response (Accepted) means that the document is still being created (perhaps due to size) and a transaction ID (`correlationId`) and document ID (`id`) are returned. Use the returned `correlationId` in a `GET /transactions` call to get the status of the document upload.

get.description:
Retrieves data about the supplied array of documents such as their properties and attachments.
Use `GET /documents/{docId}/content` to retrieve the contents of the documents.

Retrieves data about a specific document such as its properties and attachments.
Use `GET /documents/{docId}/content` to retrieve the content of the document.

put.description:
Updates a document's properties and, optionally, permissions and content.
A successful update of a document will result in an increase in the version number

The request body's MIME type should be `application/json`

delete.description: Deletes the document from the system.

get.summary: Retrieves the content of a document
get.description: If the document has content, it will be retrieved.

put.summary: Updates the content of a document
put.description:
Uploads a file to the document.
A successful upload will result in the document version being increased.

get.summary: Retrieves the permissions information of a document
get.description: Retrieves the permissions information of a document

put.description: Updating the permissions will not change the version number of the document. Both `permissionsMode` and `permittedOrgIds` should be present to properly update the document

post.description:
Searches across all documents using the provided parameters.
The full properties and contents of the documents will not be used to reduce load.  Other calls should be used to retrieve the full set of document information.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the total number of document summaries returned. Valid range is 0 thru 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Start position for the next set of paginated document summaries.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Specifies whether to retrieve the total count of document summaries that match the search conditions.

requestBody.description: Must be valid JSON.  Supported search conditions are TBD

post.description: Adds and uploads a new attachment to the document. A successful upload will result in the version number being increased.

get.description: Retrieves a specific attachment from a specific document.

put.description:
Updates a documents attachment.
A successful upload will increase the document's version number

delete.description:
Deletes a documents attechment.
A successful deletion will result in the version number being increased.

get.description: Returns the status document trasnactions that may be in progress. These transactions are identified using correlation IDs that were returned when the transaction was begun.

parameters.name: correlationIds
parameters.description: Array of correlation IDs, obtained from previous create or update requests.

get.description: If document categories are desired, a map is returned of the specified categories

If needed, a template for a specific document type can be returned.
These templates could be used to define schema or in validating and rendering documents, for example.

permittedOrgIds.description: Organization IDs permitted to access the document

minLength.description: Validator for string min length of the documentType property

title.example: Document definition for a facility certificate
